title: The 100 Best Karaoke Duets to Sing

steps.content: Maybe you’re singing on stage for the first time or dragged your partner up to the mic for a good time. Either way, you need something easy that’ll still entertain! Check out these fun but easy songs that have a guy and a girl part: “Close My Eyes Forever” by Lita Ford & Ozzy Osbourne “I’m Real (Remix)” by Jennifer Lopez “Timber” by Pitbull “Best Part” by Daniel Caesar “I Remember Everything” by Zach Bryan “exile” by Taylor Swift “Closer” by The Chainsmokers “Breaking Free” from High School Musical “You’re the One That I Want” from Grease “A Whole New World” from Aladdin “Islands in the Stream” by Kenny Rogers & Dolly Parton “In Spite of Ourselves” by John Prine & Iris DeMent “Señorita” by Shawn Mendes & Camila Cabello “We Don’t Talk Anymore” by Charlie Puth & Selena Gomez “Somebody That I Used to Know” by Gotye & Kimbra “This Is Me” from Camp Rock “Everything Has Changed” by Taylor Swift & Ed Sheeran

Challenge yourself and your partner with a song that’ll make the crowd go wild! These duets are perfect for a couple or pair of friends who already have some singing experience. So, if that sounds like you, give these songs a try: “Shallow” by Bradley Cooper & Lady Gaga “Take Care” by Drake “Don’t You Wanna Stay” by Jason Aldean & Kelly Clarkson “No Air” by Jordin Sparks “See You Again” by Wiz Khalifa “All I Ask of You” from The Phantom of the Opera “Somewhere” from West Side Story “Suddenly Seymour” from Little Shop of Horrors “Love the Way You Lie” by Eminem “Under Pressure” by Queen & David Bowie “Beauty and the Beast” by Ariana Grande & John Legend “Rewrite the Stars” from The Greatest Showman “Love Me Harder” by Ariana Grande & The Weeknd “Gangsta Boo” by Ice Spice & Lil Tjay “Ebony & Ivory” by Paul McCartney & Stevie Wonder “Fairytale of New York” by The Pogues “Empire State of Mind” by Jay Z & Alicia Keys

At the end of the day, karaoke is simply a fun time! Keep the mood fun and lively with these duets that are perfect for any experience level. You and your singing partner can even play around with some dance moves or on-stage banter with these ones! “Sunflower” by Post Malone & Swae Lee “Il Most Wanted” by Beyoncé & Miley Cyrus “Hate It or Love It” by The Game “I Just Can’t Wait to Be King” from The Lion King “Savage” by Megan Thee Stallion “Scream” by Michael Jackson & Janet Jackson “Baby” by Justin Bieber “It Wasn’t Me” by Shaggy “Me Against the Music” by Britney Spears “Anything You Can Do (I Can Do Better)” from Annie Get Your Gun “Old Town Road” by Lil Nas X “Glamorous” by Fergie “WAP” by Cardi B “Telephone” by Lady Gaga & Beyoncé “Barbie Girl” by Aqua “Defying Gravity” from Wicked “Despacito” by Luis Fonsi & Daddy Yankee “Take Me or Leave Me” from Rent “Paradise by the Dashboard Light” by Meat Loaf

Confess your love for your boo or friend with these mushy and sweet love songs. Not only are these dramatic, but they’re also perfect for any couple! Take a look at the list below to find your next karaoke go-to: “In Another’s Eyes” by Trisha Yearwood and Garth Brooks “Love Is an Open Door” from Frozen “Falling Slowly” by Glen Hansard & Markéta Irglová “Come What May” from Moulin Rouge! “Sixteen Going on Seventeen” from The Sound of Music “Need You Now” by Lady Antebellum “Could I Have This Kiss Forever” by Enrique Iglesias & Whitney Houston “Can’t Help Falling in Love” by Andrea Bocelli & Katharine McPhee “Show Me” from My Fair Lady “Let It Be Me” by Betty Everett & Jerry Butler “I See the Light” from Tangled “I’m Gonna Love You” by Cody Johnson & Carrie Underwood “It’s Your Love” by Tim McGraw & Faith Hill

If you’re not sure what to sing, stick with a song you, your singing partner, and the crowd will know by heart. These duets are classic for a reason—they’re loved by almost everyone! Sing along with your significant other, friend, or family member. “Love Shack” by The B-52’s “Ain’t No Mountain High Enough” by Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell “Don’t Go Breaking My Heart” by Elton John & Kiki Dee “On My Own” by Michael McDonald and Patti LaBelle “Stop Draggin’ My Heart Around” by Stevie Nicks “Opposites Attract” by Paula Abdul & The Wild Pair “Easy Lover” by Philip Bailey “I Miss You” by Blink-182 “You’re the Top” from Anything Goes “Endless Love” by Diana Ross & Lionel Richie “(I’ve Had) The Time of My Life” by Bill Medley & Jennifer Warnes “I Got You Babe” by Sonny & Cher “California Dreamin’” by The Mamas & The Papa “You Got a Friend in Me” by Randyman & Lyle Lovett “It’s Raining Men” by The Weather Girls “Love Roller Coaster” by Red Hot Chili Peppers “Two of Us” by The Beatles

Get all your guys or gals on stage with these multi-part numbers. These songs are perfect for groups of 3 or more and are sure to get the crowd cheering! Just make sure everyone knows what part they’re singing before you hop on stage. “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” from Encanto “What Makes You Beautiful” by One Direction “Summer Nights” from Grease “Dancing Queen” by ABBA “I Want It That Way” by Backstreet Boys “Bohemian Rhapsody” by Queen “A Million Dreams” from The Greatest Showman “Don’t Stop Believin’” by Journey “Dynamite” by BTS “Wannabe” by Spice Girls “Shout Out To My Ex” by Little Mix “ABC” by The Jackson 5 “Sucker” by Jonas Brothers “Bye Bye Bye” by NSYNC “Bootylicious” by Destiny’s Child “Bang Bang” by Jessie J, Ariana Grande & Nicki Minaj

steps.title: Choose a song that you and your partner both enjoy.
steps.content: Choose a song that you and your partner both enjoy. If you’re singing a duet, pick a song that highlights you and your singing partner’s talents. Remember, you both want to shine! This might mean picking a song with a soprano and alto part, or a song with one part that sings more than the other if one of you is feeling shy. [1] X Research source Talk to your partner before hitting the stage. While surprises can be fun, make sure they’re comfortable with the song choice ahead of time.

steps.title: Be appropriate for your audience.
steps.content: Be appropriate for your audience. Read the room—what’s the vibe of the venue and audience? If there are a lot of kids in the audience, you might want to stray away from a super sexy song. If you’re singing at a bar, it may be acceptable to get a little crazy. Go with your gut! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Put your all into your performance.
steps.content: Put your all into your performance. If you’re singing karaoke (whether with a partner or by yourself), give it your all! It’s all about confidence . Even if you can’t sing, pretend like you can. The best performances are the ones that show off your personality. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Have fun!
steps.content: Have fun! Our best advice? Have a good time! Karaoke is all about having fun, so don’t take it too seriously. While it can be exciting to show off your voice, focus on having a good time with your pals above all else.
